intro: Gravisia rodriguesiana, commonly known as Rodrigues's hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the island of Rodrigues in the Indian Ocean. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red and yellow. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in coastal areas and disturbed soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
